Text: Ack?!

Th-That was dangerous! I gotta be careful not to
trip on these jagged roads—
Did you figure something out?
...Yes.

There's no doubt this river...the Nyle River, was
once used as a transport route for goods and
human resources to Madlid.

"The Nyle River is located within the Vegalta Empire.
The river faces the remote town of Madlid and
continues downstream to the archipelago of City
States."

"As the river is nestled in the mountains, there are
few suitable coastal areas for docking due to the
steep cliffs. However, there is a coastline near
Madlid where transport ships can dock."

"While it may be difficult to transport large fleets,
the river provides sufficient conditions to be used
as a transportation route to keep the economy of a
remote town functioning sufficiently."

"According to Eta's architectural perspective, it's
highly likely the old buildings of Madlid were
successfully constructed by transporting human
resources and materials by ship."

"Furthermore, our investigation revealed that from
about a century ago, the coastline used for docking
had been claimed as the territory of a formidable
monster known as 'Malak the Malevolent Dragon.'"

"Madlid's inability to vanquish Malak led to the
town's financial depletion and the closure of its
transport route, accelerating their depopulation."
—From Gamma's Field Notes

The remote town has been depopulated and abandoned
by the central authorities because of "Malak the
Malevolent Dragon" who's been
disrupting the transport
route...

If we change our way of thinking, it's not like we
can't do anything about it, but...

If we defeat Malak...we'll be able to use this
river...for transport again.

...But...I don't think...that town is worth
...that much...

Yes. Honestly, it's not worth it. Even if we restore
peace, it will simply return to being a regular old
remote town like any other.

In other words, there's little return for the risk
taken. We can't reclaim any resources or value
even if we go out of our way to send in a task
force. No wonder the Empire has abandoned it.
And even if we discovered oil in this region...

It would require a development plan at the regional
level, such as extending the route of the Nyle River
to connect directly to the town and establishing a
canal for fleets to travel between the archipelago.

The Nyle River's current transport capacity isn't
sufficient to handle the potential demand generated
by the oil fields.

...In lieu of this, our current judgment call is
whether we should invest time and research
expenses in Madlid.

Given the nature of this land and the current
circumstances, we can't afford to heavily invest
Mitsugoshi's assets...so long as we're not certain
whether or not we'll find oil.

Even if we were to establish a Mitsugoshi branch in
the Velgalta Empire, the capital would take priority,
not here.

...You're such a stickler, Gamma. Where's your sense
of adventure?

I knew you'd say that. "Stickler" suits me just fine.
Of course, I'm not belittling our lord's wisdom,
but...

Heheh... Unless you're willing to put your research
funds toward investigating oil in Madlid?

No way is that happening! Research funds take
priority over all other uses!

There you have it... And there's no way research
funds take priority over all other uses.

If we hit oil...cha-ching...our research funds will
increase! Which means...we should definitely dig
for oil!
Seriously...Eta.

Well, let's proceed with the investigation assuming
it's a long-term plan. What lies beneath the earth
isn't going anywhere.

We're almost at the coastal area we were told about
where boats can anchor...
...Ooh, there it is...

That's..."Malak the Mavolent" the people at the town
hall were talking about!

It does have a distinctive appearance, like a giant
lizard.

But calling that a "dragon" doesn't quite ring a
bell...
Yeah...that's...a dragon. A real dragon.

Really? It's not just something the townsfolk came up
with?

That may be the case...but on its back... it's got
scars where the wings have fallen off.

If it used to be a giant lizard with wings, that's
more than close enough to a dragon.
Heheh... A real dragon...would be fascinating.

Defeat it, dissect it... There are so many exciting
things to do!
Alright...let's start investigating the dragon.

Hang on, Eta! Shouldn't we prioritize the oil over
the dragon?

Hey Eta! Waaait! What if it's as strong as the
Mist Dragon?!
